publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2837 Mark Ballard: Inquiry into Climate Change—That the Parliament congratulates the Environment and Rural Development Committee on the publication of the report of its inquiry into climate change; welcomes the conclusions of the report, including the support for interim traffic reduction targets and improved home energy efficiency; echoes calls for the Scottish Executive to take radical action to tackle climate change, and calls on all MSPs to support cross-party efforts to address both the causes and the effects of climate change in Scotland.

S2M-2837 Mr Mark Ruskell: Inquiry into Climate Change—That the Parliament congratulates the Environment and Rural Development Committee on the publication of the report of its inquiry into climate change; welcomes the conclusions of the report, including the support for interim traffic reduction targets and improved home energy efficiency; echoes calls for the Scottish Executive to take radical action to tackle climate change, and calls on all MSPs to support cross-party efforts to address both the causes and the effects of climate change in Scotland.
S2M-2837 Inquiry into Climate Change (lodged on 19 May 2005) Eleanor Scott*, Chris Ballance*, Shiona Baird*, Mike Pringle*, Robin Harper*
S2M-2837 Inquiry into Climate Change (lodged on 19 May 2005) Patrick Harvie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-2837 Inquiry into Climate Change (lodged on 19 May 2005) John Swinburne*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2837 Inquiry into Climate Change (lodged on 19 May 2005) Carolyn Leckie*, Frances Curran*, Linda Fabiani*
S2M-2837 Inquiry into Climate Change (lodged on 19 May 2005) Dr Jean Turner*
